name: Ichthyolum
Relationship: Compare: HEPAR.; CALC.; SILICA; SULPH.; ARS.; PETROL.

Eyes: Burn, red; worse, any change of temperature
Stomach: Disagreeable taste, burning sensation, very thirsty
Head: Dull frontal and supraorbital headache; worse moving eyes, cold air; better, warmth
Dull, aching; better cold, pressure
Abdomen: Griping in umbilical and left hypogastric region
Nose: Bland coryza; stuffed feeling; feels sore inside
Throat: Irritated; pain to ears; sore, dry, with hawking and expectoration
Extremities: Lameness in right shoulder and right lower extremity

details: Its action on skin, mucous membranes, and kidneys is prompt and useful. It is strongly antiparasitic; redness, pain and inflammation; decreases tension. Excellent in winter coughs of old people. Polyarthritis. Chronic rheumatism. URIC ACID DIATHESIS. Hay-fever. CHRONIC HIVES. TUBERCULOSIS, AIDS NUTRITION. Alcoholism when nothing will stay on stomach.
Natural History: )(A Combination of Sulphonated Hydrocarbons; a FossilProduct of Complex Structure found in Tyrol; supposed
to be Fish Deposits, contains 10% Sulphur
dosage: Lower potencies.Externally, it is used as an ointment, with Lanoline 20 to 50 per cent.; for chronic eczema and psoriasis, also acne rosacea and gouty joints. Chilblains, scabies. Rectal suppositories for senile prostate.
